description.narrative: 3.2. By 2021, Government and community led interventions in peri-urban and rural areas to promote adoption and sustaining of good hygiene and sanitation practices., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Wash And Emergencies, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. By 2021, children (including adolescents), and pregnant women, especially those from rural and peri-urban areas, benefit from improved and equitable access to and use of systems that deliver safe drinking water, improved sanitation and improved hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.2. By 2021, Government and community led interventions in peri-urban and rural areas to promote adoption and sustaining of good hygiene and sanitation practices.

description.narrative: With UNICEF support in the first half of 2020, the WASH Sector Contingency and Response Plan for COVID-19 was developed and approved. Over 113,423 people gained access to basic sanitation and 507 villages were certified open defecation free while over 40,000 refugees benefitted from provision of critical WASH supplies including soap and chlorine. As part of Risk Communication and Community Engagement interventions, over 4.5 million people were reached with messages on hand washing and infection prevention and control. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Number of people reached with critical WASH supplies (including hygiene items) and services with UNICEF support [COVIDSitRep]

Number of men and women, girls and boys, who gained access to basic sanitation services in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
National Water and Sanitation Policy is endorsed and under implementation

actual.value: 2020:Policy is being printed. Launch of the policy is expected to take place during the third quarter of 2020.
